application

Class PhysicsSimulation

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • application.PhysicsSimulation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConfigSimulation

    public class PhysicsSimulation
extends java.lang.Thread
    A class for running a physics simulation on a set of objects given certain starting parameters. Passes the resulting data to a renderer to be displayed on the screen.
    Author:
    Sam Dark

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Runs the simulation until the attached renderer is closed. Must init the physics sim before calling this.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • takeSimTimeLog

        private void takeSimTimeLog(long simTime)
        Logs the current sim time to be saved to a log file on close
        Parameters:
        simTime - The sim time to log

      • saveLogToFile

        public void saveLogToFile()
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Saves the sim time log to file. Saves to /logs/.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Throws exceptions if it cannot save to the file

      • init

        public void init(Renderer inpRend,
                 java.util.ArrayList<CustomObject> inpObjs,
                 Config inpConf)
        Initialises the physics simulation with some input initial values.
        Parameters:
        inpRend - The renderer to output to
        inpObjs - The objects to simulate
        inpConf - The config to run containing information about the global values and object starting values

      • initObjects

        private void initObjects(java.util.ArrayList<ObjectInit> initObjs)
        Initialises the objects in the simulation using values passes. Then initialises textures on the objects and gives them an update of 0 time. Also sets the current thread to max priority.
        Parameters:
        initObjs - The initial values to be assigned to the objects

      • sortObjects

        private void sortObjects()
        Sorts the objects in the sim alphabetically based on name.

      • update

        private void update()
        Updates the simulation based on the time since the last update. Updates the position, velocity etc of all the objects, detects and resolves collisions and then sends the updated objects to the renderer.

      • checkAABBCollisions

        private boolean checkAABBCollisions(java.util.ArrayList<AABB> inpAABBs,
                                    double time)
        Checks collisions between axis aligned bounding boxes and moves on to the next stage of the collision detection if AABBs are colliding.
        Parameters:
        inpAABBs - The AABBs to check collisions between.
        time - The time step for this update, used to resolve collisions later.
        Returns:
        True if there were any collisions False if there were no collisions.

      • resolveCollision

        private void resolveCollision(java.util.ArrayList<AABB> inpAABBs,
                              double time,
                              int i,
                              int j)
        Resolves a collision between two objects that have intersecting AABBs and updates them if a full collision is present
        Parameters:
        inpAABBs - The list of AABBs, used for reducing number of points to test for collisions
        time - The time step for this update, used for resolving the collisions
        i - The first object to test
        j - The second object to test

      • vectorLength

        private double vectorLength(Position v)
        Gets the length of a vector
        Parameters:
        v - The vector to get the length of
        Returns:
        The length of the vector as a double

      • faceNormal

        private Position faceNormal(CustomObject obj,
                            int faceNo)
        Calculates the normal of a face and returns the vector.
        Parameters:
        obj - The object the face to check is on
        faceNo - The face of the object to check
        Returns:
        The normal of the face

      • getImpulses

        private java.util.ArrayList<Position> getImpulses(Position va,
                                                  Position vb,
                                                  Position n,
                                                  double ima,
                                                  double imb)
        Gets the impulses to be applied to the objects in the collision
        Parameters:
        va - The velocity of the first object
        vb - The velocity of the second object
        n - The normal of the face the collision is happening on
        ima - The inverse mass of the first object
        imb - The inverse mass of the second object
        Returns:
        The impulse vectors in an ArrayList

      • checkAABB

        private boolean checkAABB(AABB box1,
                          AABB box2)
        Checks if any vertices in the first AABB specified are within the second AABB
        Parameters:
        box1 - The first AABB
        box2 - The second AABB
        Returns:
        True if any vertices from box1 are inside box2, False otherwise

      • updateObjects

        protected void updateObjects(double time)
        Updates the position, velocity, acceleration etc of all the objects by the given time step
        Parameters:
        time - The time step to update the objects by

      • getMiddleOfObject

        protected Position getMiddleOfObject(int objNo)
        Gets the middle point of an object using the AABB for that object
        Parameters:
        objNo - The object to get the middle point of
        Returns:
        The position that is the middle point of that object

      • getAABB

        protected AABB getAABB(CustomObject inpObj)
        Gets the axis aligned bounding box (or AABB) of an object
        Parameters:
        inpObj - The object to get the AABB of
        Returns:
        The AABB of the input object

      • checkCollision

        private double[] checkCollision(CustomObject obj1,
                                CustomObject obj2,
                                double time,
                                AABB AABB1,
                                AABB AABB2)
        Checks for a collision between two objects and returns the results of the check.
        Parameters:
        obj1 - The first object to check
        obj2 - The second object to check with
        time - The time step of this update (used to calculate the collision time)
        AABB1 - The AABB of the first object
        AABB2 - The AABB of the second object
        Returns:
        The results of the check. results[0] is -1 if the check failed to find a collision otherwise 1. results[1] is the time the collision occurred during the update. results[2] is the face of object 2 that the object 1 intersected

      • isPointInBoundingBox

        private boolean isPointInBoundingBox(Position point,
                                     AABB box)
        Gets if a point is within a bounding box
        Parameters:
        point - The point to test
        box - The box to test
        Returns:
        True if the point is within the box, False otherwise

      • checkFaceRayCollision

        private double[] checkFaceRayCollision(Position a,
                                       Position b,
                                       Position c,
                                       java.util.ArrayList<Position> points,
                                       double time)
        Checks for collisions between a list of rays and a face
        Parameters:
        a - The first vertex of the face
        b - The second vertex of the face
        c - The third vertex of the face
        points - The points of the rays
        time - The time step of the current update
        Returns:
        The results. results[0] is -1 if no collision or 1 if one of the rays collides. results[1] is the time of collision.

      • rayPlaneIntersectTest

        private double[] rayPlaneIntersectTest(Position p,
                                       Position q,
                                       Position a,
                                       Position b,
                                       Position c,
                                       double time,
                                       org.ejml.data.DenseMatrix64F n,
                                       org.ejml.data.DenseMatrix64F ab,
                                       org.ejml.data.DenseMatrix64F ac)
        Tests for intersection between a ray and a plane (triangle) and returns the time of collision.
        Parameters:
        p - The start point of the ray
        q - The end point of the ray
        a - The first point of the triangle
        b - The second point of the triangle
        c - The third point of the triangle
        time - The time of the current update step
        n - The normal of the triangle
        ab - b-a
        ac - c-a
        Returns:
        The results of the test. results[0] is -1 if no intersection or 1 if there is intersection. results[1] is the time of intersection.

      • crossProduct

        private org.ejml.data.DenseMatrix64F crossProduct(org.ejml.data.DenseMatrix64F a,
                                                  org.ejml.data.DenseMatrix64F b)
        Gets the cross product of two vectors
        Parameters:
        a - The first vector
        b - The second vector
        Returns:
        The cross product of the two vectors

        public double getGravity()
        Gets the gravity value of the simulation
        Returns:
        The gravity value

      • getElasticity

        public double getElasticity()
        Gets the elasticity value of the simulation
        Returns:
        The elasticity value
